newsitem.title: ITALY: Still time to avert metal strike-Italy minister.
newsitem.headline: Still time to avert metal strike-Italy minister.

text.p: Italian Labour Minister Tiziano Treu said on Monday there was still time to avert a strike by metalworkers called for September 27.
"It can still be averted," Treu told reporters in the southern town of Bari, where he addressed a business forum.
Metalworking and engineering unions, who have called an eight-hour stoppage, say the strike will go ahead.
Treu said the government would not become involved in mediation attempts at this stage.
Negotiations between trade unions and employers over the renewal of contracts for some 1.5 million engineering and metalworkers broke down earlier this month.
Unions have demanded an overall wage rise of 10.1 percent for their members over the next two years, while employers have offered between seven and nine percent.
If the stoppage goes ahead, it will be the sector's first nationwide strike over contracts since November 1990.
